title: Panel

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of silk and linen, satin weave with brocading wefts; painted.

artist_display:
After a design by Philippe de LaSalle (French, 1723–1803/5)
Woven and produced by Camille Pernon & Cie
France, Lyon
medium_display: Silk and linen, satin weave with brocading wefts; painted
credit_line: Purchased with funds provided by the Textile Society
publication_history:
Ernest Dumonthier, Etoffes d'ameublement de l'epoque napoleonienne (Paris: Schmid, 1909), 14.

Belle M. Borland, Philippe de LaSalle: His Contributions to the Textile Industry of Lyons (Chicago: The University of Chicago Press, 1936), 17.

Cyril G. Bunt, The Silks of Lyon (Leigh-on-Sea: F. Lewis Publishers, 1960), 10-12. 
Christa C. Mayer Thurman. "Some Major Textile Acquisitions from Europe and Egypt," Art Institute of Chicago Museum Studies, vol. II, no. 1 (Fall 1984): 52-69.

V. Ann Waterman. Surface Pattern Design: A Handbook of How to Create Decorative and Repeat Patterns for Designers and Students (New York: Hastings House Publishers, 1984), 92.

Marianne Carlano and Larry Salmon, ed. French Textiles: From the Middle Ages through the Second Empire (Hartford, CT: Wadsworth Atheneum, 1985), 62, no. 34.

Christa C. Mayer Thurman, Textiles in The Art Institute of Chicago (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1992), 89, 92, 146 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago: The Essential Guide (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1993), 234 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 64, European Textile Masterpieces from Coptic Times through the 19th Century, Sept. 27, 1989–Jan. 22, 1990.

Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 64, Aug. 1988- Mar. 24, 1989.

Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 64, Dec. 17, 1992-June 8, 1993.

Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 63, Jan. 6- June 1995.

Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 63, Sept. 24, 1997-Jan. 21, 1998.

Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 63, Nov. 12, 1998-April 7, 1999.

Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 64, Sept.12, 2005-Jan. 9, 2006.
provenance_text: Loewi-Robertson, Inc., Los Angeles, CA, by Nov. 1984 [invoice no. 16978 and incoming permanent receipt RX14333, Nov. 7, 1983, copies in curatorial object file, Textiles Department]; sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1984.
